revised_title: A New Observation of Resemblance between Carbonic Acid and Bisulphide of Carbon
tldr: The author, John Tyndall, discovers a previously unobserved resemblance between carbonic acid and bisulphide of carbon in their absorption of heat emitted by a carbonic oxide flame. This finding extends the analogy between the two substances to the vibrating periods of their atoms and has implications for understanding their behavior in dielectric media.
